snippet: The insurer is weighing several options, including an I.P.O., to create a company better able to compete with smaller life insurance and annuity providers.
lead_paragraph: The insurer is weighing several options, including an I.P.O., to create a company better able to compete with smaller life insurance and annuity providers.
abstract: MetLife announces it may spin off its retail life and annuity business in United States due to regulations put in place after insurer was deemed systemically important nonbank financial institution by Financial Stability Oversight Council.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

headline.print_headline: MetLife Is Considering Spinning Off Its Retail Life and Annuity Business
headline.main: MetLife Weighs Split of Retail Business
